text: This sounds nostalgic in all the right ways, even though it's my first time hearing it. Instant favorite.

text: Underrated gem of an RPG.  Simplistic, yet just knew how to entertain.

text: That intro sound a lot like Fire Emblem Fates
author: DobieMeltfire

text: Lost In Thoughts All Alone. Yeah, that was my exact impression as well. Always intriguing to encounter stuff like that.
author: Kid Icarus

text: Liked this within the very first few seconds.Nice rhythm and mood.
author: SirenoftheVoid

text: Wow. Forgot about this game. Worked my ass off so my parents would get me this when I was about 7, I didn't know anything about it, I was just really wanted to be a knight and a hero and I loved how the cover art made it look like he was going on a grand adventure to some far-off mystical land with his pal. I wasn't disappointed.
author: DomesticFun

text: I remember always seeing this game in stores as a kid but I was always curious about it. I remember having both this game and Final Fantasy 7 in my hands and having to pick one, I went with FFVII (clearly) but I still want to play this game some day.
author: Michael

text: Can't even tell you how happy I am to see this up. I listened to this OST so much when my daughter was just a wee tot. I think it left an impact. She's 9 now and she picks it out right away.
author: Bob

text: Weird-ass game, but I remember picking it up on a whim at a mall and having fun with it when I got home. Pretty unique.
author: Spike Rose

text: And here I thought I was the only person who remembered this game. Not the greatest thing ever made, but definitely a worthwhile bit of entertainment.

text: Love this game! Thanks for the nostalgic vgm, dude.

text: Superb game. I loved collecting the toys just to see what they did. Music was excellent too.

text: The music reminds me of something from... Touhou. I wonder why...
author: Maurice Chagall

text: +Maurice Chagall You mean like in the fighting games? Yeah, I think I know what you mean. I think it's something about that mix of smooth harmonica and synth melody, the harp in the background and a very dynamic rhythm that's very SWR-like.

text: oh man i love this game, and some of the music is just fantastic.
author: kemsus

text: I really liked this game when I bought it as a kid, I haven't replayed it since then. I still remember the FMV intro perfectly well (#151). Very easy game for people new to the genre, but also very refreshing for RPG veterans. The main reason I bought this game back then was because I read some reviews and it said you could use items like hamburgers, bubble gum, candy bars, etc., which immediately reminded me of Earthbound. Turns out it's a very different game, but I'm glad I bought it!
author: SupraDarky

text: I liked this song.  Never heard of the game though.  I'll have to take a look at the soundtrack for this game.
author: Eric C.
